result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brittney E. Scholz
Current: 416 1/2 Seymour St, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 12-01-2016)
Prior: 1500 Metro Dr Apt 16, Schofield, WI 54476

Case Called: 3:34 pm
Includes 15CM550 and 15CM891.
Clerk: Kassidi.
Defendant Brittney E. Scholz in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Sidney Allen Brubacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CM891:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.

PLEA: 
15CM550:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 5 days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment and 45 days to report, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 1 year, as is the defendant herself, and device to be installed within immediately; 1/2 priced IID installation fee to be paid; 1 year dl revocation; AODA, $1379 fine inclusive of Court Costs.

Adjourned: 3:40 pm
Court dates to remain on Court calendar at this time.
Absolute sobriety (alcohol/drugs) or unless valid prescription for meds.
